intro: Isopogon pedunculatus, commonly known as the slender leaf isopogon, is a flowering plant native to Western Australia. It is a shrub that typically grows to a height of 1 to 2 meters, featuring narrow, needle-like leaves. The plant produces small, pale yellow flowers in spikes during the spring and summer seasons. It belongs to the family Proteaceae, which is characterized by its showy, often brightly colored flowers. Isopogon pedunculatus is well adapted to the dry, sandy soils of its native habitat.
